title: Ticket #3392: Update DAGMan documentation for RETRY + SPLICE
description:
I had the following exchange with Igor: 

Date: Wed, 19 Dec 2012 08:35:33 -0600
From: Nathan Panike <nwp@cs.wisc.edu>
To: Igor Sfiligoi <sfiligoi@fnal.gov>
Cc: wenger@cs.wisc.edu
Subject: Re: Q about mixing retry with splices

On Tue, Dec 18, 2012 at 05:55:18PM -0800, Igor Sfiligoi wrote:
> Hi Nathan.
>
> Quick question about mixing RETRY statements and splices in dagman.
> (I could not find an explicit reference in the manual)
>
> If I have a DAG like this:
> JOB A a.sub
> SPLICE B b.dag
> SPLICE C c.dag
> JOB D d.sub
> PARENT A CHILD B C
> PAREND B C CHILD D
> RETRY A 3
> RETRY B 3
> RETRY C 3
> RETRY D 3
>
> Will it work?
> What will be the semantics if B fails? Will it re-run the whole b.dag? Only the failed nodes?

Igor,

It won't work.  Internally, SPLICE expands into a bunch of nodes, and
RETRY only works on a node at a time.  If you want to retry the whole
b.dag, you must change to SUBDAG EXTERNAL.

What I expect to happen: SPLICE expands to a bunch of nodes, named
(say): B+A, B+B, B+C.  DAGMan will look at the RETRY statement and not
find a node B that matches. So the complaint would be something akin to
"No node B found".  I have not tried it.  Hopefully DAGMan will give a
helpful error message, and not silently fail.

This is something I have been working on (eliminating the differences
between SPLICE and SUBDAG EXTERNAL), but my changes break rescue and
recovery and I have not worked all that out.

>
> Thanks,
>   Igor

Probably would be helpful to clarify this in the manual...
